intro: Oxytropis kyziltalensis, commonly known as the Kyzyltal legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in the Tien Shan and Pamir ranges. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, compound leaves. It produces yellowish or reddish flowers in clusters, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees. Oxytropis kyziltalensis is adapted to grow in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
